thread.title: Xero hits 100,000 subscribers as small businesses turn to the cloud
thread.title_full: Xero hits 100,000 subscribers as small businesses turn to the cloud

title: Xero hits 100,000 subscribers as small businesses turn to the cloud
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Xero hits 100,000 subscribers as small businesses turn to the cloud The Ring of Bells pub on the edge of Dartmouth National Park has signed up Google Street View Google+ 1 of 1 The Ring of Bells pub on the edge of Dartmouth National Park has signed up Google Street View Nic Fildes Technology & Communications Editor Last updated at 9:13AM, September 30 2015 
Xero, the New Zealand small business software specialist nipping at Sage’s heels, has hit 100,000 customers in Britain as more companies have opted to move their book-keeping to the cloud. 
The company, which is valued at NZ $2 billion after losing a quarter of its value over the past year, has been the beneficiary of Britain’s booming start-up scene with newer companies less likely to buy traditional software for accounting and to pay their employees. 
Xero has picked up customers including Grind, the independent London coffee chain, the Veglo cycle safety gear company and Emma Lomax, the embroidery business, over Subscribe now 
To see the full article you need to subscribe Subscribe
